entity_name: Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support)
summary: The Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support) was responsible for overseeing security matters, including the issuance and management of alias documentation and the approval of covert sites. The documents indicate their involvement in approving alias documentation for individuals like James P. O'Connell, Harold F. Swenson (under the alias Harold Francis Safley), and Cal William Hitch for operational assignments. They also approved the issuance of a CIA identification card under the alias 'SAFLEY, Harold F.' for an employee of Task Force W. Additionally, they were involved in the security approval of a covert site in Silver Spring, Maryland. The role appears to be primarily administrative and supervisory, ensuring security protocols were followed in various operational contexts.
key_connections: Chief of the Technical Services Division
significance: The Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support) doesn't have a direct connection to the JFK assassination based on the provided documents. Their significance lies in their role in managing security protocols, including alias documentation and covert site approvals, within the CIA during the early 1960s. The documents highlight the procedures and approvals required for covert operations and the use of aliases, providing insight into the operational security measures in place at the time.
